ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: At the beginning, Survey, Child Development, Women Empowerment & SHG formation, Education and Training programs were undertaken by the Trust, and thereafter, acceleration and addition in activities like Art & Handicraft Develpoment, Health Services, Environment & Wild-life Protection, Forestation, Human Rights / Advocacy, Micro-enterprise dev, Youth Development and involvement in Community Development works etc were made day-by-day. In subsequent years, activities and strength of Serve-SEWA amplified ensuring Sustainable livelihoods for poor, Mainstreaming of Helpless female, mF for SHG members and NRM etc. Capacity Development & Training is one or the main activity. With sincere sponsorship by NABARD,Canara Bankand other agencies, need based capacity building training were organized for Farmers,rural women & girls. Trust run 03 regular training centre for rural female.Production cum Sale centre is in function. Women Empowerment & SHGs - Nowthe total number of women SHG has gone to 103 with membership of 1500. NABARD has supported under SHPI scheme while these groups are linked to Banks. Gender Mainstreaming activity is focussed to assist helpless & destitute female to join the socio- economic mainstream. Efforts are made to organize Women Kissan clubs. Education Programme specially for poor rural girls are a regular activity of the Trust. Helpline Education Centre is in function for formal and Non-formal methods of guidance for students. With colleboration of local Govt. departs, the Trust is running Health and Child Development Schemes. Besides this, several Workshop , symposium, training Camp and Facilitation ceremonies are organized. Sustainable livlihood program for rural poor, with special focus to women, is another main activity of the Trust. More than 3000 families are benefitted with different type of locally suited IGPs with due training, linkages andmarketing support.Promotion of local natural resources and its enviroment friendly use for development is ensured with appropriate mechanism.Micro enterprise Development, Mocro finance support , Vocational Trianing are its common feature. The Trust also care for awareness generation on Govt. Programs & schemes like NREGA, RTI, Pulse Polio,Aged care, peoples with disabilities, PDS & consumer protection,beside climatic changes,legalAid, study & Research and prepare micro plans for village development. { Detail information about the Activities, may be collected from Trust Office)

The program focused on schedule tribes and schedule caste communities who are the most marginalized communities; the main aim of the program is to building resilience among the communities to cope up with such emergency and disastrous situations in future. Situation have analysed and based on impact of poverty to the target communities – e.g. their livelihood opportunities, community health, linking of migrant workers and other vulnerable communities with government entitlements or schemes.

The main aim of the program is to support the tribal communities for functional institutions towards achieving socio-economic wellbeing through socially and politically dynamic participation in decision making bodies (Gram Sabhas) and being sensitized to the needs of the most vulnerable community members. Tribals are more vulnerable and marginalized due to their poor socio-economic conditions and access to various eligible government entitlements and flagship program.

Tribal and forest dwelling communities once gain control of rights over forest resources would be the opening door to the largest land reform in state’s history. Both PESA and FRA promote community participation in the conservation of natural resources and livelihood security of the forest dwellers and forest dependent communities. Both legislations aim at addressing these two crucial aspects of governance through Gram Sabhas.
